TMAX.title: Extreme high temperatures: areas where maximum temperatures are above 35ºC for at least 30 days on average per year

FROST.title: Extreme Low temperatures: areas where minimum temperatures are below 0ºC for at least 15 days on average per year

PMAX.title: Extreme precipitation: areas where maximum 1-day precipitation is above 50mm on average per year.

FLOOD.title: Extreme precipitation:  areas prone to flood events with 100-year return period

RTL.title: Landslide: areas where median annual rainfall-triggered landslide is above 0

SPI.title: Drought: areas where the Standardized Precipitation Index is below 0%

FIRES.title: Wildfires: areas where the fire frequency is above 1 on average per year

SST.title: Ocean temperature: areas where the temperature of the sea at surface level is above 25ºC

SSPH.title: Ocean acidification: areas where pH at surface is below 8.085
